STYLE.TEXT:
<style type='text/css'>
		a {
			text-decoration: none;
		}

		#back {
			color: red;
			font-weight: bold;
		}

		.error {
			color: white;
			background-color: red;
			font-weight: bold;
		}

		.tbutton {
			white-space: nowrap;
		}
		</style>

HELP.TEXT: To view an on-screen demonstration of a topic, click "Show Me". To view the demo with spoken narration, click "Tell Me".

HELP.WHEN: When on the main bubble area
HELP.TEXT:
Click links below to view/hear help demos:

» Drag the bubble area
» Resize a bubble
» Move a bubble
» Remove a bubble
» Search the project code
» Search the documentation
» Search both code and docs
» Put up the simple toolbar
» Show the current area context
» Change the focus bubble
» Augment the programmer's log

Click links below to view/hear help demos:

» Resize this bubble
» Move this bubble
» Remove this bubble

Click links below to view/hear help demos:

» Resize this bubble
» Move this bubble
» Remove this bubble
» Make this bubble the focus
» Get this bubble's context menu
» Fix this bubble's location
» Link this bubble to another

HELP.WHEN: When on a bubble group outline
HELP.TEXT:
Click links below to view/hear help demos:

» Move this group
» Remove this group
» Title this group
» Merge a bubble into this group
» Merge two groups
» Resize a bubble
» Remove a bubble

HELP.WHEN: When on a singleton bubble group outline
HELP.TEXT:
Click links below to view/hear help demos:

» Remove this bubble
» Merge this bubble into a group
» Resize this bubble

HELP.WHEN: When on a link between bubbles
HELP.TEXT:
Click links below to view/hear help demos:

» Remove this link
» Change the link style
» Collapse this link

Click links below to view/hear help demos:

» Move the viewport
» Change the viewport
» Move a group of bubbles

Click links below to view/hear help demos:

» Create a working set
» Clear the display
» Load a saved working set
» Print the current display

Click links below to view/hear help demos:

» Change the name of a working set
» Change the size of a working set
» Remove the working set
» Save the working set
» Export the working set
» Clear the display
» Print the current display
To scroll the bubble area, drag with the right mouse button. Alternatively, you can use the arrow keys while pressing the Control (Command on the Mac) key. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To resize a bubble, press the left mouse button on the proper border and then drag to make the bubble the desired size. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To move a bubble, press the right mouse button and move the bubble to its desired location. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To remove a bubble, click with the middle mouse button on the bubble or its border. Note that a remove bubble will replace this bubble and will slowly fade to nothingness. You can click on this remove bubble to restore the original bubble. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To search over project code, click with the right mouse button or use the control-O (command-O on the mac) key or the F10 key. Using the right click will bring up the default menu; the others will not. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To search over documentation, control click with the right mouse button or use the F12 key. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To search over both code and documentation, shift click with the right mouse button or use the F11 key. This also brings up the default menu. this can be made the default by selecting the appropriate option. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To put up the simple tool bar, use F1. The tool bar will appear in the upper left or upper right of the display (depending on where the package explorer is located). [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To show the current area in context use F9. Hitting F9 again will go back to a normal display. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To change the focus bubble, either move the mouse to it or use the arrow keys while pressing ALT to move to the nearest bubble in the specified direction.
To augment the programmer's log either by adding a note, image, or screen dump to the current task, or to change the current task, hit F2.

To get a context menu for this bubble, right click inside the bubble. Note the actual context menu might depend on where in the bubble you click since it can represent the local context. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To fix this bubble's location on the display, right click and choose Make Fixed if the option exists.Not all bubbles can be fixed in this way. To undo this setting, right click and choose Make Floating

To link this bubble to another, press the control key and then drag a line from the starting bubble to the ending bubble using the right mouse button. This will unlink the bubbles if they are already linked. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To aove all bubbles in this group, press down in the group border drag with the right mouse button and drag to its desired location. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To remove all bubbles in this group, double click with the middle mouse button on the group area. The remove bubble that remains will restore all bubbles in the group. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To title this group, left click on the title area at the top of the group and type in (or edit) the group name. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To merge a bubble into a group just move that bubble (using right-drag) until it joins the group.
To merge two groups, place the groups near each other and then move a single bubble so that it spans the groups and makes them one.
To remove this link, either control-drag a line from the start bubble to the end bubble or click with the right mouse button to get a context menu and choose [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To changke the link style, right click on the link and choose the Style option you want. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To collapse a linke, right click on the link and choose the Collapse option. This will bring the target bubble close to the source bubble. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To move the viewport, press the right mouse button in the current viewport in the overview bar and drag it to its new location. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To change the viewport, click with the left mouse button at the desired viewport location. You can also press down to move the location and then drag it to its target. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To create a working set, click with the left mouse button in the area above the current view, where "Create Task..." is displayed. Alternatively, use the right mouse button to bring up a context menu by clicking where there is no working set and choose "Create Working Set". [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To clear the display, use the right mouse button to get a context menu and then choose either "Clear Bubbles" to remove all bubbles visible in the current viewport or "Clear All Bubbles" to remove all the bubbles in the workspace. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To load a saved working set, use the right mouse button to get a context menu. Then either choose "Load Working Set" to load the working set from a file or choose a working set from the task shelf, which is the selection to the right of the menu. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To print the current display, use the right mouse button to get a context menu and choose the "Print" option. Alternatively, you can choose "Export as PDF" to produce a image file for later use. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To change the name of a working set, click on the current name with the left mouse button and then use keyboard editing to enter a new name. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
To change the size of a working set, press down with the left mouse button near the side to change and drag the edge to the desired size. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To remove the working set, use the right mouse button to get a context menu and then choose one of the following: "Remove Working Set" will remove the working set but leave all the bubbles in place; "Clear and Remove Working Set" will do this and remove all bubbles in the set; "Close and Save to Task Shelf" will save the working set to the task shelf, close the working set and clear its bubbles. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To save the working set, use the right mouse button to get a context menu and chen choose one of the following: "Save Working Set" to save the working set to a file; "Save Working Set To Task Shelf" to save the Working set to the task shelf where it can be quickly reloaed later; or "Close and Save to Task Shelf" which will save the current working set to the task shelf and will clear its bubbles and remove it. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]

To export the working set, use the right mouse button to get a context menu and then choose one of the following: "EMail Working Set" to send the working set in a loadable from in an e-mail message to a colleague; "Export as PDF" to create a saved image of the working set; "EMail as PDF" to send an image of the working set; or "Save Working Set" to save the current working set to a file. [ Show Me ] [ Tell Me ]
